text:
Great beer. Awesome service. Fantastic poutine. 

We came in and sat at the beer and they were happy to accommodate!  Cleared out space for us and immediately asked us what kind of beer we liked. Let us try a bunch until we found the one we wanted.

Chatted with the bartenders and they gave us a bunch of tips on what to do in town. Definitely recommend!

Nouveau bar dans le coin, remplaçant le tabasco. Déco intérieure en bois très sympathique, plusieurs billards dans la salle du bas. C'est tout neuf !
Les bières sont très bonnes, la carte est a peu près équivalente du saint-houblon du quartier latin. Allez-y le mardi soir, la la pinte est en hh toute la nuit !

Petit bémol pour la nourriture qui reste a mon gout trop chère, mais on y va pour boire = )
Pas mauvais
Les plats sont bons mais Le service était ridiculement long. Je déconseille pour précéder un spectacle..

Nice selection of craft beers (eventough that all of those listed on the menu aren't available yet; they do have to build up their inventory), warm atmosphere (all floors and tables made of genuine wood), food is excellent even though the portions could be a bit bigger. I took the "flanc de porc" with the corn/shrimp salsa. The salsa was incredible and perfectly spicy to my own taste (used to think that in Montreal, anything categorized  as spicy isn't spicy enough.... can't help it, local people are just not used to spicy things). The flanc de porc was crispy, tasty and well cooked. MIAM!

Service was very good. The waiter wasn't always pushing us to have more beer and the food has been served in about 15 minutes. Just enough to enjoy your first pint.


The second floor is interesting. There are nice spots to either invite a date or for a small business meeting



So, in a nutshell, a food  pub that worth the detour. Now, let's see how they will evolve over time! Will they keep their promises?

The food here is fantastic - especially the duck poutine - and the Mac n cheese. They would be at 5 stars if they only had additional help when I went (which granted was late on a long weekend Sunday) - it resulted in a delicious duck poutine being Luke warm vs hot. Otherwise, great job!

Blessed be the server who took pity on us.... we were walking all around Le Village assuming there would be food there at 3 in the afternoon.... whoops! Nothing looked good. It was raining, and we walked all around for a long time. Almost settled for some mediocre looking place because we were so tired and soaking wet. Then like a light at the end of the tunnel, we saw Saint Houblon. Didn't even care what they had, it was open, looked warm and they had food.

As soon as we were seated, the server gave us two free beer samples because he's a good person. We ordered some beers and they had a decent vegetarian selection for the wife. I, on the other hand, order a duck confit pulled pork burger with cranberries and goat cheese (yes please!) and some of the best damn frites I've ever had. 

They had one of those TV beer menus which I'm iffy about, but the server was super knowledgeable about beer so it didn't matter. 

There were other great looking food items on the menu that I would want to try again. And if I'm ever in town again, I will be back. And to the tall, thin scruffy server whose name I didn't catch? Thank you. You're amazing.

Lunch service was extremely slow,  but wait staff was friendly. They really need to add an additional waiter or two. Portions were decent,  but the fries that came worth the beef burger were dry and cold. Nacho chips were also not warm enough.

Possibly the worst meal/experience I've had in a while. We were seated at the bar, right across from the (smelly) trash with a look into what seemed to be a dirty kitchen filled with staff that didn't care too much about getting food out to the tables. After waiting 40+ minutes our food arrived cold. The waitstaff was apologetic and deducted one of the dishes from our bill, but still a pretty bad experience.

Great service but really the food is just average.  Very disappointing that we trekked out what was supposed to be a gastropub. It's not bad though if you're in the nabe.  Sit outside and enjoy the people watching.
Super belle place, bien situé par contre ils n'ont de menu de bières... pour une place qui vend ses mérites, c'est un peu décevant....

This place has a great great beer selection, and the service was really good too! Probably one of the best waitress that I have ever had in quartier latin! Really wanted to like this place, but the food was just a disaster... it was just so greasy that's uneatable! Please improve your food, and please don't deep fry your waffle and put mayonnaise on it ... it's really not a great idea and it's really not decent at all!

Service excellent et bière tout aussi bonne. Le décor est splendide et moderne. La seule raison pour laquelle je n'ai pas donné 5 étoiles au Saint-Houblon est pour l'espace incroyablement confiné; le bar était plein à craquer, bruyant et il était difficile de converser alors que des groupes hurlaient autour. 
À leur défense, c'était un vendredi soir.
J'y retournerai définitivement pour essayer leur terrasse lors des périodes de beau temps!

Great experience here - for food and for drinks. Delicious, affordable cocktail; seriously delicious burger; very tasty pork nachos. Outdoor seating was nice. Friendly, punctual waitresses. Highly recommend!

Okay, maybe not quite 5-star, but had a great lamb burger (done perfectly, which means a good amount of pink) and a very good beer.  The staff are super friendly and helpful. The best part was it was the après midi special. Basically, get a dish over $8 and your beer (tho not all beers) is a buck! Magnifique!
Great craft beer and amazing poutine! Everything I hoped for when choosing this place!

We found this cute little place by chance. It was literally the only place that was open and we were starving. Turned out to be a great choice though. 

The food is a little bit different. For example we were there for breakfast/brunch and you don't just get pancakes you get pancakes with a whole bunch of goodness all over them. All my friends enjoyed all their food as well. 

Our server was very pleasant even though she had to deal with a bunch of Americans ... 

We would definitely go back if given the opportunity.

My friend and I stopped for drinks on a Sunday evening after a concert. We had a great waitress who was very helpful in explaining the beer selections. The beers were great as were the Jameson nightcaps. I liked the vibe and decor of Saint-Houblon. Next time I will try something from their eclectic/interesting menu.

RIP Tabasco!
I had the greasiest burger at this place the other night. The bun was literally dripping which is too bad because other than that it was really good and so were the fries! The beer was cold and the waiters were friendly. 

I feel like the Tabasco offered better prices but other than that it's pretty much the same. Tons of space for all your friends!

Belle découverte grâce à mon Passeport en fût! La serveuse prend le temps de nous conseiller une bière selon nos goûts. Nous avons essayé les Oreo frits comme dessert: excellent! Endroit sympathique! Le seul détail: il n'ont pas de menu en version imprimée puisque leur sélection de bières change souvent et le menu sur les écrans est un peu difficile à lire!

Nouveau gastropub sur st-Denis proche de l'UQAM. Situé dans l'ancien local du Chlorophylle, on ne reconnaît pas l'endroit. Aménagé sur deux étages, avec un décor moderne/vieux : bois, brique, cuir et d'énormes baies vitrées à l'avant.

Nous sommes bien assis et peu importe l'endroit tu ne te sens pas coincé (sauf peut-être au bar). 

J'ai trouvé la nourriture bien ordinaire pour être honnête. J'avais pris le burger d'agneau (qui était détrempé), mais les saveurs étaient quand même au rendez-vous.. la sauce était bien assaisonnée. Un gros plus pour les sangria et les drinks qui sont, disons-le, très forts et surtout très ' bons dans yeule '
Le service est un peu lent, mais ça va. La bouffe n'est pas pire surtout les nachos. J'ai bien aimé le mojito que je prend à chaque fois. L'ambiance est assez sympa.

What a blast. Ambiance is really cool, with comfortable two sweaters at the bar. Beer selection is large- with some really great SH homemade beers. I'm a big Hefeweizen and sour fan and there was plenty. We got the poutine with their delicious stout maple syrup and duck and it may be hands down one of the best poutine dishes we've had all weekend! Would definitely recommend stopping in. Thanks Alexandra for great service!
Peu de variétés de bières. J'aime bien essayer les poutines dans les microbrasseries. Tout était ok, mais les frites réchauffées 2 ou 3 fois au microonde, weak.

Excellent ! Un diner parfait , ils ont un rabais dans le jour. Tout les repas a plus de 8$  peuvent etre acompagner par une bière pour un supplement de 1$ !!!! Wow ! 

J'ai mangé le burger d'agneau au feta , il etait parfait et la serveuse etait vraiment tres gentille ! 

J'aime beaucoup l'endroit, le restaurant est bien situé et très beau !

I actually came to a private event in the upstairs room here, which in of itself was great, but this was my first time as a regular walk-in customer. I always was curious about this place with its huge (and apparently popular) terrace and interesting exterior. 

After some confusion about how we were to be seated, we finally found a host and were seated inside (there was a terrace seat but it was a little too warm outside for our taste). 

After waiting awhile for our server to greet us (this was a theme of the night) we ordered a couple alcoholic beverages, the fried chicken plate and the burger. 

The beverages and chicken arrived in reasonable time. The burger? Waited. And waited. And... "excuse me, is that burger coming?" Long story short, the order never went in to the kitchen, so it never got started, so we just cancelled the order. Which on one hand was perfectly fine because the portion for the chicken order was HUGE, but on the other hand, cmon homie if you can't remember the order maybe you should write it down (what's with servers here thinking they can memorize orders?). And maybe a good gesture might've been a free drink or appetizer, just saying. But I digress. The chicken was surprisingly fantastic. 

Other than that, the place has a cool, albeit busy vibe, plays good music, and I'm sure that terrace is great when the wether is right. Hopefully one day I'll be able to try that burger. Or the ribs. Menu had promise. Probably wouldn't want to come here during peak hours; not particularly interested in the drunk college student scene. 

So 4 for the chicken and the beer options (they have gluten-free beer!), 2 for the painfully slow and inattentive service, so a solid 3 overall. And yes, we'll be back.
Nice service les mardi soir, 100% recommandé. La leader d'équipe Chloé offre un service incroyable

L'endroit est idéalement situé sur St Denis à deux pas de l'UQAM, du Cineplex du quartier latin...et plus généralement de toutes les festivités du centre ville! 
C'est une brasserie chaleureuse, pleine de bois et qui possède un étage et, non pas une, mais deux gigantesques terrasses! 
C'est un endroit bien connu par les amateurs de bières puisqu'il y a un énorme choix de bières artisanales...
Sur ce point il faut absolument souligner (pour les personnes ne buvant pas d'alcool) le fait qu'il font également une limonade au houblon à tomber....
Tous ces attirants breuvages peuvent être accompagnés de plats....pour lesquels vous attendrez....attendrez......attendrez beaucoup trop de temps!
Parlons justement du menu.....il est assez conséquent et propose des plats de bistro traditionnels et quelques originalités (gravlax de saumon) 
Mon choix s'est porté sur le poulet frit sauce chino, blé d'Inde au beurre d'érable et habanero,salade aux carottes, canneberges et sésame! 
Très pompeux sur le papier mais assez décevant en réalité...le poulet était gras en plus de la panure frite sur le dessus, la salade de carottes et canneberges n'avait pas trop de goût! L'épi de maïs était bon et très relevé! 
Les personnes qui m'accompagnaient ont opté pour le poulet et gaufres, pas très copieux et avec une panure un peu épaisse! 
Je reviendrai mais plus pour boire un verre entre amis!

Sometimes the places you find by accident are a delight. We were taking the Metro from the Olympic area when it broke down, forcing everyone off in a less-than-stellar part of town. So we took an Uber to a main Metro hub, with the intent of going back to Old Port. However, folks were getting hangry, so Yelp to the rescue. This place sounded great and was steps away from the station. We were warmly greeted by Gabriel, who was our server and all around nice guy. They gave each of us a sample of their many beers while we perused the menu and then again before we left. My babaganoush was a nice take on this dish, as was my dad's peanut chicken bowl and sister's eggs benedict. The rest of our party had burgers, which were tasty but the rolls were over-toasted...however this barely diminished our good time. Coffee beer, summer stout and  white sangria were all going down easy. It was our daughter's sweet 16 and they comped her dessert. This ended up being the most fun we had all day.

Came on st Patrick's day and to my surprise not a soul in sight was wearing green.. not the place for st Patrick's day if that's what you are looking for.

They have 3 floors when I went the top floor had improve 
The middle floor where I sat had high bar tables and solid wood chairs with high back so it's not your typical bar stool.

They have a tv screen around the bar with what kind of beers they have. Bottom floor has pool tables and seating as well.

Bathrooms are extremely small 2 stalls for the women's and 1 stall for the men they need more then that for 3 floors but hey that's just my
Opinion.

What atttacted me to this place was the outdoor seating they have tables with a fire pit Inside and you can sit around but when I went we just had a storm so no such luck for a fire.

Service was a little slow place was packed but drinks weren't expensive so that was a plus 2 doubles cc and ginger ale $16.

I 100 percent will come back this summer or spring just for the outdoor seating.

During my past visit to Montreal this was a close spot to where I was staying. Seems to be a relatively young hangout which is expected due to the nearby university. Came in for dinner on Tuesday evening and we seemed to be one of the only people ordering food, everyone else was just having a drink. The place was packed for a weeknight, and there were only 3 people working bar and tables so it was a bit of a wait on the ordering and waiting for the check. I commend the staff though, they were very friendly during all our interactions. Our server offered his recommendations as well as beer samples for everyone in the party. We ordered the chicken schnitzel burger, Sisig, and salmon dumplings. I was very surprised to find a Filipino dish on the menu. The salmon dumplings are a good choice if you want to stay healthy but also splurge a little on dish choice. The sisig wasn't prepared as I expected, but it's still worth the try (comes with a side of udon noodles, and I never say no to noodles). Overall my favorite was the chicken schnitzel burger and fries. This place would be a great spot for brunch. Its in a nice neighborhood with a patio/outdoor seating.

drinks were good and food was okay but other than that it's not my favorite place. the host both times i've come was extremely pretentious and tried to push us out even though we were ordering food and drinks and the table behind us was drinking water and playing cards for hours. the waiter we had was super great but the host being the first and last person you see here kinda threw it off. and food is an odd menu but it's possible to find something

You can't find a better lunch deal in Montreal...buy an entree, and your first beer is only $1!  

Inside is a slightly worn but nice rustic brewery setting, giving it a casual yet distinguished atmosphere.  The Quebecois ladies will quickly and kindly switch to English once you open your touristy mouth.  I think there were 30 something craft beers available on tap, most were reasonably priced at $4-6 in case you want that second beer. 

VISIT #1: $15 Mac N Cheese with beef brisket...its huge and delicious!  The beef is marinated in some sort of secret sweet deliciousness, and cooked tenderly.  Probably one of the best mac n cheese's ever! 
 
VISIT #2: $15 Poutine with beef brisket...generous portions of that same tasty beef on top of a generous portion of golden frites and cheesy cheese curds, topped with that lovely Canadian poutine gravy. 

The wife also had the lamb burger and a fried chicken sandwich, both were also savory and delectable.  I almost had to knock down a star, the place was never more than a third full, but the food took over 30 minutes.  Maybe its just made with extra Canadian care and love, but if you're in a hurry you might need to eat elsewhere.

Très sympa, large choix de bière!
Par contre, la porte d'entrée ne fermait pas et il faisait assez froid toute la soirée :( (ou alors il fallait aller se lever à chaque fois que quelqu'un entrait pour aller la fermer..)
Bon service, beau décor, ambiance relax!

Randomly found this bar. New in town. Service was amazing; go see Alexis bearded lumberjack-ish gent. Ask for his maple whiskey drink and you won't be disappointed. They have a few dozen brewed beers to choose from. Had the mango one and it was on point. Washrooms are clean. Good for groups as most of the patrons were. But bar is also great for the beer confiseur. Crowd was chill (this is based on a Saturday night) and non pretentious. Also good for a date night too as ambiance is not too loud that you don't have to yell. Cheers mates !

Unbelievable experience. The food, the ambiance, the service...all top notch. Try the aguachile, it's an incredible take on ceviche served with some sort of delicious chip! Bar had some sort of steak tips dish whose name escapes me at the moment but was delicious with this mashed yucca and fried pickles. The deep fried Oreos are insane as well. God bless Canada. Our friendly neighbors to the north!

Good?: BEER!
Bad?: The 5 tomato "gazpacho" was nothing more than some tomato chunks in tomato water, and that for $15.
Okay?: The beef tartare was decent, but needed a good splash of my emergency hotsauce. 
Should I go here?: Meh, there's enough (better) food places around those parts, but if you want to try some nice beers I guess you'd be in the right spot.
Pas impressionné. Le serveur nous a oublié avant même de nous remettre les menus. 20 minutes passé, passé 3x devant nous mais ne semble toujours pas nous voir.

Surprinsingly enough, there are days and hours when it is quite difficult to find a place to eat around this area. And so, to stop our endless wandering, we entered Saint-Houblon.
The inside is warm and woody and well decorated. The staff is friendly and welcoming. 
And the food... It's good pub-style food with a hint of originality, i.e., your usual burger and fries plus that little thing you wouldn't expect.
It's good and filling. Though be prepared to pay the price for this hint of originality.
And since it is after all a pub, we tried their beers. The pale, the stout and the amber. They're good to quench your thirst but I would't bring my belgian friends here!

Great food! Cool ambiance!
Not the best beer in MTL but they have a good selection. Good location, gotta try it!

We were here for a friend's birthday. I was the last one to get in and the first one to get my food and my drink, somehow! I obviously did not object to this, but it made me feel a tad bad for my friends. Pretty good burgers, and plenty of fries to eat afterwards :)

I am not a beer connoisseur but my friends were very happy with all the beer selection they had! I just ordered a double IPA because I was advised to have that. 

I especially recommend the Fried Oreos!
Umm.... the service was good! The beer was good, but that's most places. The food looked good on paper but it was rather bland like 6/10 hence the three stars.

Nouveau bar, nouvel ambiance dans le quartier Côte-des-Neiges.
Remplaçant le Tabasco bar, le Saint-Houblon est un énième lieu pour les étudiants ou les travailleurs après une longue journée de travail.
Les bières proposées sont bonnes avec de multiples variétés : IPA, Pale Ale, Stout, il y en a pour tous goûts, et vous ne serez en aucun cas déçu! Quant à la carte, pas d'inquiétudes : de la poutine aux nachos, en passant par les burgers et les bols végé, c'est encore une fois un très bon point à noter.
La décoration reste moderne, avec un côté très boisé limite hipster. Le service reste variable : autant pour certaines journées il peut être rapide, autant à d'autres moments, vous risquez d'attendre un long moment.
Toutefois, la terrasse en été est parfaite pour profiter du soleil et de votre pinte. Et astuce : le mardi, les pintes sont au prix des verres!

Le Saint-Houblon apporte de la fraîcheur et de la nouveauté dans le quartier, ce n'est que du + !

Incroyable comme les plats sont bons pour une micro !! En particulier les accras de suaumon, vraiment très tendres, avec une farce bien tendre et pas sèche du tout ! Et une mention spéciale pour l'aioli à l'ail noir (servi avec les frites)... au tooop !!
Les bières sont plutot pas mal aussi, elles accompagnent bien le repas :)

Par contre, gros point noir : le service. Il était certes souriant, mais punaise, qu'est-ce qu'il était long !! On a quand même dû aller chercher le serveur pour qu'il vienne prendre la commande... Et après 20mn il vient nous dire que la bière que l'un d enous avait commandé était épuisée... Vraiment pas top, d'où les 3 étoiles seulement
Bière excellente, de nombreux choix, services parfait le service est très bien et connait la carte et les bières à la perfection. Je recommande vivement ce bar

Friendliest bartenders in Montreal, great selection of craft beers and the awesome bartenders will give you samples to try to help find the perfect beer for you and as in my case offer an orange slice to balance an IPA and make it phenomenal. Seating is wood and not very comfortable, neither is the journey upstairs to get to the toilets but I suppose that is rather the norm in Montreal. We shared an order of pulled pork nachos and both of us couldn't even finish them all, so the portions are very adequate. We sat on the patio for a while but it is very busy and the service gets quite slow, service is much better inside. I really like the vibe here and the bartenders make the experience a memorable one with their energy, enthusiasm and quirky sense of humor.
A lively place to hang out with your young or young at heart friends, great food, friendly and helpful staff.  Reasonably priced.  Will go again if in Montreal.

Un de mes broue pub préféré. Grand choix de bières de micro-brasseries québécoises. Bouffe succulente et originale. Personnel super gentil et de bons conseil. Ca fait 2 ans que j'y célèbre mon anniversaire avec ma blonde et des amis.

J'adore cet endroit. Très grand et bon choix de bières. La nourriture est excellente. La poutine offre une bonne portion et un bon rapport qualité-prix. Le poulet est un peu gras, le boeuf trop goûteux. La meilleure est celle au canard. Les brunchs sont aussi très bons, quoique plus coûteux. J'y vais souvent après de longues soirées à  l'UQAM, pour fêter, pour manger tard, avant ou après un spectacle, etc. Un endroit au coeur du quartier latin, accessible et qui convie t à tous les goûts!

A bar with a good selection of beer and food. I went here with a group of 4 people, and we decided to try this bar on Saint-Denis. 

The beer menu is displayed on a screen on the wall. I would personally prefer to have a paper menu for this. At one point the screen was even having problems and blacked out. However, the waitress was very nice and ended up writing down some choices of beer for us, which we ended up trying and enjoying.

The place is very busy and noisy, like most bars in Montreal. Our waitress was very friendly and attentive.

I ordered the Tsukemen, a noodle dish with duck, boiled eggs, soba noodles, shiitake mushrooms and a dashi broth. For food coming from a bar, it was really good. My companions ordered some ravioli stuffed with ox tail, and nachos as an appetizer.

We decided to try the desserts too. 3 of us tried the apple pie, and 1 of us the cannoli. I thought the apple pie was a little bland and overcomplicated. There were cashews inside as well as cream chevre cheese, but despite all that, the apples themselves didn't have any seasoning.

All in all, everyone was happy with their meals and beer. I'd go back for sure.

Bar très sympa rue saint Denis qui nous ouvre ses portes sur une grande salle s'étendant sur deux étages. La salle est belle, tendance, animée car la foule est nombreuse. De nombreuses personnes de rassemblent pour déguster l'énorme choix de bières artisanales que nous propose cet établissement. L'inconvénient est que la liste des bières se trouve sur un écran un peu haut. Mieux vaut avoir une bonne vue. Mais les serveurs sont de bon conseil. On peut également y manger, y boire un cocktail, ou encore boire un verre de vin québécois. Le service y est agréable, souriant et rapide. Une bonne adresse pour venir boire un verre entre amis !

Very good atmosphere especially their terrasse during summer. I love the seating outside in the sun while having a cold beer and a hot snack. Loved their assorted burger thing. 
Their fries too is very good. Nice hangout in summer.

Bon petit bar très grand même puisqu'il y a un étage. Idéalement situé non loin de Berri uquam et du Cineplex, parfait pour aller boire un verre entre ami ou même y manger.

Cette fois ci j'y était seulement allé après le cinéma pour boire un verre mais un ami a commandé un burger qui était très bon.

Ce jour là il y avait un peu d'attente et le serveur nous a offert un verre de bière pour patienter ce que j'ai trouvé très sympa.
Je reviendrai sûrement pour tester leurs plats la prochaine fois :-)

Service deluxe, plats intéressants (hey, les pogos avec saucisse maison et petite sauce funky, c'est le paradis ou quoi?), deux étages (et demi?) donc plein de place, je capote.

Parfait pour satisfaire les gens qui veulent boire et ceux qui ont faim. Genre "moi j'irais au resto souper" pis "je veux juste me saouler pour oublier".

Le staff n'hésite pas à nous faire goûter les bières avant de nous servir et de bien cerner nos goûts. Ça, c'est adorable. 

Seul point moins intéressant: les prix. Mais bon, on se rattrape sur tout le reste.
Excellent, spacious patio, really great beer selection, and a friendly server who took our experience to the next level. Must-visit on St. Denis!

Nice neighborhood bar, not far from universite de montreal so a lot of students tend to go there. Its a micro brasserie, they make their own beers and also we go a little tester of the beer of the day which was nice even if i dont like beer it was a thoughtful & smart marketing moves. They have over 15 variety of beers and also a nice food menu with some vegan options (which is always appreciated)

Premier test de ce bar grâce au passeport en fût !
La place est grande, il y a une terrasse et même un étage, c'était assez remplis quand on est venus mais ca doit le faire en temps normal.

Il y a un large choix de bière et de nourriture, les portions sont assez bien servis et la bière est bonne. 
Un bon endroit dans le coin pour venir se gater, j'ai toujours un peu de mal à choisir dans ce coin de Montréal par peur de rentrer dans un truc à touriste et au moins ici je suis sur de la qualité.

Expérience à renouveller un autre jour !
Service is fantastic and the food is even better. All though this is a bar, the food is surprisingly good. Try his place if your in Montreal, it's definitely worth your time!

Been here a few times while visiting Montreal and it's always great. The selection of beers is awesome and there service is great. Duck confit burger and duck confit poutine are amazing! Highly recommend!

Best value drinks in the city! $15 for a 1 liter cocktail is unbeatable and the cocktails taste great and have a good amount of alcohol. However, the food is up and down depending on the time and the plate you choose.

If I could give less than a star I would.  Got seated and 10mins later no service no beer.   Maybe it's because we didn't speak French?  I understand when a place is packed it's hard to serve people but don't seat me next to the door and walk back and forth and not see if I want something.

And then after mega late service and not checking about food, we couldn't even get our check.   3 servers only out of which 2 spent the entire time outside and one staples stuff at the bar.

Really enjoyed trying this spot! The service definitely stood out, providing patrons with samples of their IPA as we waited to be seated. The available beer flights gave us an opportunity to try many of their delicious beers. The piri piri tortellini special blew our minds; it was delicately spicy and complimented the beer. Beer not your thing? The cocktails are uniquely delicious and expertly crafted.

This place was our first in Montreal and it didn't disappoint! Great draft beer selection and creative cocktail menu. They offer a full lineup of spirits made in Quebec, which were all outstanding (we had a flight). We didn't arrive until almost midnight, yet they still had a expansive menu offering well above average bar food. The bartender was really great and very excited to welcome us to Montreal. Saint-Houblon was a great first Montreal experience. So glad we walked in!!

Recommended to us by a hostel staff, this place was loud and not worth the long wait to get in on a Friday night. Most people come for the drinks rather than the food. They somehow messed up duck poutine, which sounds great but the dish was too heavy and oddly sweet.
Food is very good and creative! Cant find any similar menu in that area.  Lots of artisinal beers to choose from and all sorts of drinks. Patio outside and pool table downstairs. Pretty cool place.

J'ai testé la terrasse du saint houblon par un jour de beau temps. La terrasse est relativement grande mais c'est bruyant car la route est bien passante. Bon malgré tout c'est un bon endroit' J'ai trouvé que le serveur était bon et connaissait bien les bières. Je lui ai juste dit ce que j'aimais et il a trouvé une bière correspondant parfaitement ... en plus la pinte a 5$ autant dire que c'était intéressant.

Je ne sais pas a quoi le bar ressemble a l'intérieur mais je peux dire que les assiettes que j'ai vu passer donnaient envie.

Place par excellence pour un 5@7 ! L'ambiance deest décontractée, la place est belle et chaleureuse, les serveurs sont super synpathiques et en plus c'est pas dispendieux pour la qualité qu'ils offrent ! 

Nous avons pris le plateau de charcuteries et fromages et c'est de loin l'un des plus fourni et des meilleurs que nous avons mangé! Nous avons aussi goûté aux nachos saucisses et guac et c'était tout aussi bon! Sinon, le playeau de crustacés est à essayer!! 

Vraiment un endroit à aller si vous êtes amateur de bonne bouffe et de bonnes bières !

I was generally satisfied with my first time at Le Saint Houblon. It's very well located, the interior design and general atmosphere was very pleasant. The food was good and the portions were generous. The beer was also good, from what I heard they have an agreement with Brasseurs Illimités for their beers.

However, on the bad side, it was hard to know what those beers were. The was no menu, and the waitress couldn't tell us the choices, so I ended up ordering "well whatever dark and strong beer you have". They do offer a degustation plateau of about 8 different sorts though, but a beer menu would be a good idea.

Our waitress was very kind, but had a few hiccups, such as confusing or forgetting our orders from time to time and was a tad slow. But she was so kind and kept apologizing so it was hard to be mad. The place is relatively new, so I won't hold it against them. Perhaps it was her first day. 

Also we went on a Friday night and the place was packed. You better get there early if you want a place on those busy nights.

Will definitely be back!

Excellent service, une bière blonde maison tout à fait appréciable, et cette proposition indécente de cocktail au litre! Un "Baiser sucré", à la fois doux et surprenant, une belle soirée en perspective!
J'ai testé le poké bowl, une option bien élaborée et rafraîchissante, mon conjoint a opté pour les nachos, il était pas mal convaincu.
Comme digestif le "Coureur des bois" est aussi à la carte! Un petit plaisir canadien qu'il est nécessaire.

Pensez à réserver!!
J'ai essayé 2 drinks et les deux se sont avérés vraiment pas bon.  La bouffe est passable. Belle terrasse. Je ne recommande pas.

This place was really cool with friendly service. The beer was very good and the staff was happy to help suggest or have you sample. Food wasn't amazing (we had jerk chicken nachos - which weren't very jerk-y) but definitely good. We would return for the beer in a heartbeat!

On est de retour sous les soins très compétents et chaleureux de Laurence avec deux amis avec qui on veut partager un bon repas dans une ambiance conviviale on est encore complètement satisfaits. Pour moi les Pogos , le reste une poutine champignons, un Burger d'agneau, et des tacos poulet le tout arrosé de leurs excellentes bières et cocktails.

Looking for a place here in yelp for a good last night experience in Montreal. This place nailed it with good food, drinks and a chill ambiance. Coming in u can already tell that this is more of a local hang out but our server Louis was very welcoming and patient even with the place continuously swarming. We came in at 5:30 and all the tables were already full FYI

Meh beer and food
This place looks pretty cool at first. Craft beer and pub food. But it's pretty expensive for average to poor beer. No vegetarian options. 
I got the poutine and it was ok at best.
Not really worth it.

Saint-Houblon is really nice bar / brew pub. Drinks menu is pretty long, cocktails, wines and a lots of beers, but not on the menu. The beers you have to figure out from the multiple TV screens hanging on the walls. Depending on where you sit you may see or not the list, and descriptions. On a hockey night the beer list is gone and of course the Habs take over the screens. On such a night our waiter had the difficult task to figure out what kind of brew exactly we would like to try. He was nice and willing to bring samples for those who couldn't decide.

The space in the pub is well designed. There are multiple seat options, low and tall tables, good for small and bigger groups, and the comfy seats in front of the bar more suitable for couples. The pub offers nice food menu, we focused mainly on the snack choices, and my fries had yummy aioli dip, but one of my friends truly enjoyed her burger. 

Service is nice, but a little bit on the slow side as it is getting late and busy. Saint-Houblon is in between the three and four stars, prices are very competitive, but all the beers I tried were a little bit underwhelming. I would definitely come back and I hope to be able to choose a brew from a readable list that will win my heart.

J'ai du mal à croire que je n'ai pas encore e
écrit de review sur le St-houblon, je suis une de leur plus grande fan!! C'est un super bar/restaurant avec de la nourriture de qualité supérieure !!

Je suis tombée dessus lors de leur premier mois d'ouverture quand je travaillais dans le quartier puis quelle découverte. Leur menu est tellement appétissant !! En une année on était tellement fan qu'on avait déjà goûter tous leurs burgers en plus d'autres de leurs plats. 

Avec leur grand succès ils ont également ouvert une seconde location à Côte des neige et pour couronner le tout ils ont maintenant une ferme qui fournit leur restaurants en produits frais et locaux (WOW!!). 

Leur menu change selon les saisons mais ils ont des plats signature qui restent sur le menu tel que le burger de canard qui est tellement savoureux et crémeux avec du fromages de chèvre, ou bien leur mac&cheese aux poireaux qui est réalisé avec une vraie sauce au fromage pas orange comme kraft (extra yum!!). Ils ont également des plats végétaliens et sans gluten pour partager le fun avec tous tes amis. 
Pour finir ils ont également des desserts décadents qui satisfont ta dent sucrée ! 

Je sais pas se que je peux dire de plus, à part qu'ils ont une très grande sélection de bière locale qui sont très bonnes puis si tu t'y connais pas les serveurs conseillent vraiment bien.

I question the palate of people who like mac and cheese here. It was one of the most flavourless mac and cheese ever. They seemed to have used only one type of cheese and the weird tint of sweetness was appalling. I've had better mac and cheese somewhere else. I understand that it is unfair to evaluate the entire establishment based on one food item, so I am willing to try something else in the future. However, my first experience was meh.

The service was great by the way. The server constantly walked around our dining area to check on us.

Bon! L'endroit vient d'ouvrir et il faut laisser la chance au coureur... Je me promets d'y retourner dans 6 mois à un an, pour voir s'ils sont arrivés à en faire quelque chose de décent.
Mais pour l'instant...
Déjà, il y a l'aménagement...  L'espace est très peu convivial, découpé en banquettes, avec des murs de séparation, ce qui rend la communication avec les gens autour à peu près impossible.  Ça évoque vaguement une rotisserie St-Hubert, en plus joli, il faut bien le dire...  Autre comparaison avec la célèbre chaine : des télés un peu partout, branchées sur le canal sportif.  Pendant une soirée du hockey, je peux comprendre, mais sinon, ça n'est qu'agaçant.  Qui aime être bombardé de publicité et d'information sur la carrière de Wayne Gretsky quand il boit sa bière avec ses amis?  La musique n'est guère mieux...  J'avais l'impression désagréable que quelqu'un avait synthonisé CHOM à la radio...  En somme, tous les ingrédients étaient réunis pour créer une ambiance totalement navrante, tout juste bonne pour plaire à des banlieusards n'aimant pas être dérangés dans leurs petites habitudes.
Côté bière, il paraît que la sélection était tellement incroyable que le serveur n'a même pas pu nous la présenter!!!  Sérieux!  Pas de liste des bières disponibles!  Il a donc fallu lui dire qu'on voulait une IPA pour qu'il nous dise ce qu'il avait (il nous a parlé de deux bières, je ne sais pas s'ils en avaient d'autres).  Seul point positif, quelqu'un m'a dit qu'ils tiennent à peu près tous les produits de Simple Malt, qui est un bon brasseur.  Ma IPA était fort convenable...
Finalement, le prix paraissait raisonnable (7$ la pinte), jusqu'à ce que je réalise que les taxes étaient en sus (donc 8$ la pinte).  C'est cher payé, je trouve, mais il semble que cette escroquerie devienne la norme dans le quartier latin...

Bref, un endroit où on ne fait pas de rencontre ni de découverte, et où l'on paie trop cher pour une ambiance morne.  Je prédirais sa fermeture dans l'année, s'il n'était situé dans un quartier hautement touristique, fréquenté essentiellement par des gens habitués aux grandes franchises, et qui ne rechigneront donc pas en payant cher pour une expérience fade.

Premièrement, la serveuse est super! Très amicale et professionnelle. Mais la pauvre petite cours entre les deux étages et ne fournit pas. Il n'y a aucun leadership ici, personne pour t'accueillir à la porte et pas de gestionnaire alors que la place est pleine à craquer. Je ne voudrais pas de sa job. Ca prend 75 min pour recevoir un plat. Le busboy arrive avec le dessert alors que le plat principale n'est même pas arrivée. Une des assiettes était complètement froide et tu reçois de la pieuvre au lieu du veau; ma mère a demandé du pain et on lui répond qu'on en a jamais servi ici, un bordel total. Cela dit, la double IPA était bonne et voir le chaos de la place est un spectacle des plus divertissant!

We came around 11pm on a Saturday. The terrace was packed. The beer menu is on the screen. I had a hard time to read it across the room so I find a better way - my cell. In Yelp I found their website where the beer menu as well as wine and food menu is on. We had two beers, 500ml size, and a house fries. One is Irish red ale and the other was cider beer. I like the cider one because it was so sweet. 
 I hope they offer more choices of appetizer kinds of dishes on their bar menu which sticks to 1am. I don't want a full size meal at mid night. 
The staff was very nice and attentive. Will come again.

Je viens régulièrement dans ce bar. Situé près de l'UQAM, l'ambiance est jeune, le service agréable et l'endroit est toujours occupé semaine ou week end. La nourriture est particulièrement bonne pour un bar, je vous recommande leurs différentes poutines ainsi que les burgers. Les nachos sont un peu secs à mon avis et j'adorais les tacos au tartare de saumon, mais ils semblent avoir changé la recette et manque de sel, voir de goût. Pour mon prochain essaie, je me dois de tester le dessert d'oreo frits fortement recommandé par les serveurs hmmm!!

Mon nouveau 3e bureau entre les cours à l'université et l'hôpital. Il y a des ambiances pour tout le monde : pool, terrasse, banquette, salle de réception. 

Les bières 100% micro québécoises sont bien choisies et présentées dans des verres appropriés. On peut meme goûter avant. 

Le meilleur est dans la nourriture inventive. Goûtez au canard de Pékin pour 2, bien relevé aux 5 épices et parfaitement croustillant. 

Vous êtes seul avec votre pinte ? Goûtez à ma nouvelle poutine préférée de tous les temps, surpassant la poutine déjeuner au homard de Les Affamés et toutes les tentatives d'ajouter de la viande de qualité: la Poutine au Canard de Pékin. Ça goûte le ciel.

This location is perfect for summer weather with a ton of space to sit on a really pretty patio outside (Street level and rooftop). Good choice of beer and cocktails , as well as food options ! The prices are cheap and the service is very friendly and efficient.  We tried their Mojito and a strawberry basil cocktail and they were both refreshing and well prepared and very reasonably priced, we ordered some fries with that and they were also very good (they had nice spices on them and they were cooked really well) , The fries come with a really tasty garlic sauce . They offer a bottomless brunch option as well on weekends for 35$ . I can safely say im coming back here for brunch, cocktails and to try their other food options.

Great restaurant to stop by if you're in Berri/UQAM - St. Denis area.

One thing I love about Montreal is that the restaurant is allowed to put a patio on the street and you get to enjoy the curbside dining. 

St. Houblon offers some great saisons and food. 

Beef Tartare and Lamb Burger were to die for. They gave you a lot of fries along with it. 

Will definitely come back again to try a few more beer. The waiter was very friendly despite the language barrier.

Petit nouveau dans le Quartier Latin, une autre micro-brasserie, près de l'UQAM, coin St-Denis/De Maisonneuve, parfaite pour les étudiants après les cours. Leur bière vient des ''Brasseurs illimités'' de Ste-Eustache. L'endroit est encore nouveau, assez terne donc encore des trucs à améliorer, le service, la déco par contre la bière (pinte 6$) était bonne. Menu correct, exemple; Burger de boeuf brie/cheddar (12$). Prix abordables. Je suis arrivé en après-midi, y'avait pas grand monde et soudainement vers les 18h/19h, les gens (en grande majorités des étudiants) ont commencés à rentrer à pleins portes, lorsque je suis parti, c'était rempli et très bruyant. J'attendrai quelques temps avant de revenir pour voir l'amélioration, sinon y'a pleins d'autres bonnes micro-brasseries sympas dans le coin pour étancher votre soif. Wifi gratuit. 

*ps: Menu déjeuner/brunch tous les jours de 8h à 11h30 am !

4/5 visité en février 2015.

One of the things I love about the place is that their staff is super friendly and attentive. I walked in without knowing what to get and the girl asked me some questions and gave few suggestions on what to get. I took her advise and ordered a cider and Oh what a great choice!

Their small but cute terrace is perfect to relax and have a beer or perhaps two on a sunny day. The location is on a busy St.Denis street with so many other bars and pubs, but I have a feeling that this place will be very popular especially in summer.

great service. really good drinks and beer selections,  best poutine gravy around. the wait staff is very friendly.  we stopped in here more than once during our visit to Montreal,  we were never disappointed
Propose un grand choix de bières de microbrasserie. Place très grande et adapté aux groupes. La nourriture est de bonne qualité.

Surprisingly good beer bar. We were just walking around looking for someplace with curbside seating and found Le Saint-Houblon (we had gone to Saint Bock the day prior and wanted to try something different).

Much to our surprise, Saint Houblon also prides itself with its beer selection (inside, they have lots of TV screens showing their menu). Service was quick and our waiter was nice enough.

The beer is great, the food sadly no. I had their in-house apple cider beer since I prefer sweet beers and it was great. The price was reasonable too (pint for $6.5). However, the food was horrible. We ordered a regular poutine and a mushroom and garlic nachos. The poutine was dry and the sauce was weird. The nachos were one of the worst I've had. Grainy guac, dry cheese, there was nothing to like.
I'd say stick to their drinks.

The server was nice though.

Come for the beer - stay for the food! The food is definitely a notch above ordinary pub food, prepared with attention to detail and presented ever so beautifully. They manage to add a little twist to such standard items as tacos or chicken and waffles, thus elevating them to gourmet goodness!
Oh, and the craft beer selection is amazing, too!

Great prices, music is good and the duck poutine is fantastic. However, the service was terribly slow. According to a regular customer, we went on an off day. Hmm, that would explain why the server did not bring us our shots on the first, second, third, or fourth attempt but the fifth. Maybe that would  explain why she ignored us as we were waving at her as she walked by our table. And I guess that would explain why she got angry at my friend when she asked for our drinks for the third time. See here is the real reason why this happens: the servers are too focused on tips. So if server 1 is too busy with his or her tables and server 2 is not then it would make sense for server 2 to help right? Yep.But not here. server2 will not help. Server 2 can only remind server1. I'll try it again soon.

Great service, great food! Would definitely return again!! The breakfast was well presented and cooked perfectly. Not your typical breakfast place, but definitely should be on your list of places to visit.
Terrasse sur St Denis, bieres, sangria, repas etc , beau local, service attentioné. Bcp monde.
